span.span: MSHSL "Lights On for the Community" Initiative
In cooperation with the MSHSL and in support of our community, Nicollet Public School is joining with dozens of area schools to turn on stadium lights,
(Friday evenings for 20 minutes and 20 seconds starting at 8 pm)
as a way to honor our students, staff and community members in this time of distance learning while school buildings are closed due to Covid-19 concerns.

"The lights are a symbol of hope and an assurance that you are in our hearts and on our minds. We would like to extend the window for our community to get some exercise. Let these lights represent faith that life will return to normal one day! We will fill this stadium again, and we will fill our hallways and classrooms again! We miss you, we are here for you, and you are in our hearts and minds; we can’t wait to see you again! The lights will not be on April 10. Thank you!"
Click on the link below to see the meaning behind a NPS student's art project.

All families need to be here from 6:00-7:30 p.m.
You may choose to come earlier or stay later to play
with your child in the Kindergarten room.
5:30 – 6:00 p.m. Family time in the Kindergarten room

br.b:
6:05 – 7:30 p.m. The children will stay in the Kindergarten room
for activities. Parents will go to the Community Room
for questions, discussions, and completion of
necessary paperwork.
7:30 – 8:00 p.m. Family time in the Kindergarten room
